div1.p: Docket entries- Feb. 26 1885 Territory of Washington vs. E. Romick}
Action brought upon affidavit J P Weymouth saying one E. Romick with the crime of stealing (5000.) Five thousand cigars, the property of one complaint filed Feb 26 1885

Warrant said: " " " W. H. Smallwood Pros. Atty. Case called at 4:30 P.M. Feb. 27th Personally appeared defendant also Pltff by Pros Atty for Dist. One motion of Pros. Atty connected by defendant council, case was continued until 7 PM same day.

Case called at 7 PM. Personally offered defendant also council on both sides. S.C. Hyde & W.H. Smallwood for Jury. and Cat Sullivan and T S Roadman for defendant following witnesses are sworn and testified in small of the Territory.
C F Bassett. Geo H. Meyer
C J Wardlow, Jno Cody M.J. Maloney Jas W Ryan H.J. Prosecution rests.
Counsil for defendant had following witnesses sworn J.J. Maloney. W R Shelton J C Burns.
After which the case was opened and submitted. The court after due deliberation finds that there is justifiable cause for guilt.

Therefore it is ordered a and adjudged by the court that the defendant E. Romick be held & appear at the court at the District Court holding terms at Yakima City Yakima County W.T. in the sum of Five Hundred dollars for default of which he is com- mitted to the jail in Yakima County
Given under my hand this 27 day of March February 1885. E.G. Pendleton J.P.
